reviewText: not to be touched by this story! Cancer movies have been done, most of them a tad corny, but this one was perfect. The acting was professional (the kids did a great job. And Sam Elliot - what a good looking older man!), the scenery beautiful and the concept behind the movie - moving the holidays forward a month - a novel one. The story was not built around inducing the viewers tears with deathbed scenes, but the life of a sick little girl and a neighbor with a big heart. Yes, I will admit the ending may have gotten a bit carried away and there were certain characters we're left hanging on (the teenage girl working on her children's book?) but other than that, this is truly a heart-warming film with a terrific cast! (Not that I'd ever pay $30 (asking price) for this movie! Good grief. Find a Hallmark store and pay $20, if you want to own it.)
summary: you'd have to have a hard heart ...

reviewText: Once you watch this heartwarming video you will truly understand that Christmas in not a time of year but rather a condition more closely related to a kindness of the heart we often call love. Brotherhood and hope are two of the messages spoken very clearly in this film and they are contagious. Watch it and see for yourself.
summary: Watch this and understand what the spirit of Christmas is

reviewText: This is a touching movie about a family dealing with a child who has a serious illness.  It has a beautiful story and the actors do a great job making the characters come to life.  I am sure the story in this movie parallels what some face in real life.  It is very uplifting and I love seeing it every year.  I highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys entertainment free from violence, sex, and cursing.

reviewText: I have no new praise to add to what has already been offered.  This is a great movie.Prospective buyers should note that the product details show a run time of 110 minutes.  It was actually 94 minutes.  Not a huge deal for me, but some people might object.  Hallmark routinely shows run times of 110 minutes, even though their DVDs usually run 94-95 minutes.

reviewText: There were only 2 left when I ordered this DVD! If you havent seen this movie you are really missing out on something  special! This movie will go on to become a great Christmas classic! Even though the Hallmark channel runs this movie in November and December every year; I just had to have it as part of my Christmas movie collection! Amazon, thank you so much for carrying this DVD too! You rock!

reviewText: If you like/love old Sam Elliot...this is the movie for you.If you like to cry off and on during the movie... this is the movie for you.If you like holiday flicks, (timely or other-wise), this is the movie for you.If you like cute little girls who are dying through-out the movie... this is the movie for you.If you like very good acting, pacing, sound-track, filming, scenary, etc... this is the movie for you.If you like/love old Sam Elliot...(did I already ask that?), this is the movie for you.I could go on and on......... This was/is a super movie.  I watch it so often, I think I'll wear it out.My wife even likes it and she seldom sniffs, let alone crys, during a movie.For plot... give the kid a holiday/days before it is too late.  The parents share a similar situation with Sam and his wife.... Oh, heck, watch this thing!!!!  It is one of the one or two best movies like it...even better than, "The Ultimate Gift"!  Sorry Mr. Garner!)
summary: Has it all and then some........

reviewText: ...made for TV movies I've seen. I am clearly not a crier, but this movie is very well done and there are parts that make me get misty.  I watched it when it debuted on CBS and then have seen it everytime they air it on Hallmark Channel.  There is something really wholesome about this movie that is endearing.  It is a little slow in parts (especially the hospital scenes), but even those minor flaws don't diminish the final product.
